article_title: Eugene Litvak: Don't Get Your Operation on a Thursday
article_text:
New York, five other states and the District of Columbia are considering legislation that would mandate minimum hospital-nurse staffing levels. The Massachusetts Nurses Association is planning an initiative for the November 2014 state ballot asking voters to approve a law setting minimum staffing levels for all hospitals, a change they say would alleviate the dangerous strain on overworked nurses and result in improved patient care. The nursing associations in the six states (including Texas, Iowa, Mass., N.J. and Minn.) fervently support such legislation. In turn, hospitals vehemently oppose staffing mandates.

...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Eugene Litvak writes that legislation can't fix hospital overcrowding. Better scheduling of surgeries can.
twitter.title: Don't Get Your Operation on a Thursday

article_metadata.author: Eugene Litvak
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Don’t Get Your Operation on a Thursday

article_summary:
New York, five other states and the District of Columbia are considering legislation that would mandate minimum hospital-nurse staffing levels.
In turn, hospitals vehemently oppose staffing mandates.
The nursing associations in the six states (including Texas, Iowa, Mass., N.J. and Minn.) fervently support such legislation.
The Massachusetts Nurses Association is planning an initiative for the November 2014 state ballot asking voters to approve a law setting minimum staffing levels for all hospitals, a change they say would alleviate the dangerous strain on overworked nurses and result in improved patient care.
